author: tersec
content: I am wondering why the initial step of getting a blinded execution payload (it's called slightly different things in different spec variations) finds it useful to return anything beyond some basically useful, but more-or-less opaque nonce. In particular, the parent/previous-head block determines most of the fields, and the only real variable then is the transaction set.

author: tersec
content: I don't want to conclude too much from what some non-production mocks use, but the idea that all the existing ones I've seen so far have of using the transactions root as this opaque nonce seems basically unambiguous?

author: lightclient
content: I think a fair number of the fields in `BlindExecutionPayloadV1` are actually derived from executing /producing the block, e.g. `stateRoot`, `receiptsRoot`, `logsBloom`, `gasLimit`, `gasUsed`, `extraData`, `blockHash`, and of course, `transactionsHash`. So the unnecessary fields are `parentHash`, `feeRecipient`, `prevRandao`, `blockNumber`, and `baseFeePerGas`. My weak arguments for keeping them are i) I think it simplifies reasoning about it, because the object is almost exactly equivalent to the spec object `ExecutionPayload` and ii) it simplifies a potential dispute that may arise from using a different `randao` / `parent` than was requested (although in the worst case, we'll still need to fully execute the block to say the provided state root was invalid)

author: tersec
content: More broadly, though, regardless of the specific contents and which are functions of execution and which are straightforwardly filled in by knowing the parent block, so far I'm not seeing scenarios where they're used in that intermediate role by the CL -- the CL depends on the builder to select from the relays, in this design.

author: tersec
content: There's another overall design question: to satisfy their role, it seems like the relay s will need to sit on both EL & CL gossip networks (because of how the proposeBlindedSignedBeaconBlock or analogous RPCs are chosen). There's an argument, at least, that this increases the investment/skill floor for a working relay and thus decreases the decentralization.

The following flow seems reasonable to me:
```
CL calls builder_setFeeRecipient in advance
...
CL calls engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV1 to local EL and initiates payload build process

Builders start to build blocks on all forks they observe
Builders (relays) gossip execution payload headers + feeRecipientBalance over p2p
local mev-boost collects proposed headers

CL calls builder_getBlindExecutionPayloadV1
Use returned payload header or fallback to local EL if the above call fails or responds with invalid payload header

Blinded beacon block is signed and either builder_proposeBlindBeaconBlockV1 or regular gossip is used to publish a block
Block proposal routine responds with a block obtained either from response to builder_proposeBlindBeaconBlockV1 or locally
```
